<div class="boxy boxy-primary">
#### <abbr title="Variance tells you the degree of spread in your data set. The more spread the data, the larger the variance is in relation to the mean.">Variance</abbr>

$s^2 = \frac{\Sigma(X-\bar{X})^2}{N-1}$

`var(mean)`

</div>




<div class="boxy boxy-primary">
#### Standard Deviation

$s = \sqrt{\frac{\Sigma(X-\bar{X})^2}{N-1}}$

`sd(X)`
</div>

<div class="boxy boxy-primary">
#### 95% Confidence limits on z (upper and lower)

$X = \mu \pm 1.96\sigma$
</div>

<div class="boxy boxy-primary">
  #### <abbr title="Gives the Standard Deviation of a set of data as a standardised number">Z Score</abbr>

  ${z = \frac{X - \bar{X}}{\sigma}}$

  given an area, find the boundary value that determines this area.

```{r}
  qnorm(0.5,mean=100,sd=15)
```
</div>
